report_title: Industry Report: Electricity and Signal Testing Instrument Manufacturing
executive_summary: The Electricity and Signal Testing Instrument Manufacturing industry produces a wide variety of products. These products include a multitude of instruments used in electrical integration and testing equipment for electrical, radio, communication circuits, motors, and other niche devices. The industry benefits from a range of customers in varying industries, including defense and aerospace, automotive, and scientific research. The differentiation in downstream markets the industry serves has helped to shield the market from the extreme volatility that was experienced in 2020. Overall, industry revenue is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 0.7% to $12.6 billion over the five years to 2022, including an increase of 3.1% in 2022 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During most of the period, economic growth bolstered private investment and demand from the private sector, which benefited research labs and automotive manufacturers. Increased federal funding for defense and research and development has propped up demand for industry products, especially during the second half of the period. Despite strong downstream demand, an appreciating US dollar has limited revenue growth and has aided in supporting import penetration into the United States, making domestic products less attractive to US consumers.

The coronavirus pandemic and the disruptions that followed fueled a massive contraction in the US and global economies. Due to the global contraction, several key downstream industries would feel the effects. Primarily, research and development expenditure and industrial production experienced the largest disruptions in 2020, which in turn, reduced demand for industry products. In addition to declining downstream private sector markets, there would also be a drastic decline in international trade, further dampening industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2027, industry revenue is forecast to grow as both the public sector and private sector rebound from economic declines. Research and development spending along with federal funding for defense are both expected to increase during the period, providing strong downstream demand from the public sector moving forward. Meanwhile, the value of the US dollar is expected to fall during the outlook period, which will likely boost industry exports, benefiting international trade.

Internal competition is likely to drive productivity for the industry during the outlook period, and in turn, support additional investments in product innovation and research and development (R&D). R&D expenditure is expected to increase an annualized 3.0% over the five years to 2027. Large investments in R&D generally enable for further production of new products from industry operators, specifically in electricity and signal testing instruments.

The industry is expected to experience several shifting trends during the outlook period. Specifically, the number of industry enterprises is expected to increase, growing an annualized 0.4% to 687 companies over the five years to 2027. However, industry consolidation is expected to limit enterprise growth during the period, which is likely to only benefit larger companies leading this consolidation. Enterprise growth is also expected to drive employment; industry employment is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 1.7% to 33,650 workers over the five years to 2027.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures electricity and signal measuring and testing instruments. Products manufactured include electrical integrating instruments and test equipment for testing electrical, radio, communication circuits, and motors.
key_trends: Many industry operators have many defense, aerospace, and government entities as clients
Increasing regulation among product standards has boosted demand for industry products
The number of industry enterprises is estimated to decline due to the appreciation of the US dollar
Internal competition is likely to drive productivity for the industry
The CHIPS and Science Act will likely increase demand for industry products
Import penetration remains an ever-present threat to the industry
Economic growth bolstered private investment and demand from the private sector during most of the period

market_segmentation.segment_description: Exports are expected to account for 50.6% of revenue in 2022. As the largest market, foreign companies express notably high demand for the Electricity and Signals Testing Instrument Manufacturing industry.
The industrial and manufacturing market accounts for an estimated 14.5% of industry revenue in 2022. This segment includes a variety of manufacturers using electrical components in production.
Semiconductor testing requires industry products, namely parametric analyzers. Many industry operators produce testing equipment specifically made for semiconductor manufacturing.

Industry operators have benefited from rising 5G wireless investment over the five years to 2022. The industry provides equipment used in mobile device manufacturing as companies test phone performance on developing 5G and 4G LTE networks.
The aerospace and defense market is expected to account for 8.6% of industry revenue in 2022. Government contracts for automated testing equipment is a key driver of industry growth.
The medical market constitutes a smaller share of industry revenue, accounting for 4.6% of revenue in 2022. Medical device design and testing also requires industry equipment.
Retail often includes sales to electricians, HVAC professionals, and construction workers. Handheld products may be sold to wholesalers, small businesses, or retailed to individuals.

products_and_services.product_description: Oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers give insight into the behavior of an electronic signal by measuring and displaying waves. The equipment includes a small screen for analysis.
Signal generators produce varying electronic signals at different amplitudes and frequencies. These devices are key to testing electronic circuits under different conditions.
Multimeters measure the capacity, voltage and current of an electronic signal. Unlike oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers, these devices display numbers instead of an image of the wave.
Source measure units source and measure electronic signals and waves. In a sense, this device combines the functionality of a generator and oscilloscope, or analyzer.
Handheld meters are the simplest and least expensive industry product. These devices are often retailed to electricians, technicians, HVAC workers, and construction workers.

tier_1_suppliers: Wire & Cable Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Copper, Nickel, Lead & Zinc Mining in the US
Copper Rolling, Drawing & Extruding in the US
tier_2_buyers: Semiconductor & Circuit Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Semiconductor and electrical component design and manufacturing is a major driver of industry demand. Since a large portion of electrical component manufacturing takes place outside of the United States, international trade dynamics affect industry performance.

international_trade_points.trade_description: IBISWorld expects the value of imports to increase at an annualized rate of 3.2% to $9.0 billion over the five years to 2022. Generally, threats of import penetration come from less technologically involved products, since they can be produced more efficiently and inexpensively in countries with lower labor and production costs.

The value of exports has declined 1.6% to $6.4 billion over the five years to 2022, which includes a substantial decline in 2020 as the coronavirus pandemic took its toll on the US economy and international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The West region contains 24.2% of establishments in 2022, making it the most popular location for industry operators. Historically, the West has been a hotbed of technology innovation, which attracts skilled employees and provides operators with access to a wide selection of labor.
Following the West, the Great Lakes region contains the next-highest number of establishments, home to 15.8% of business locations in 2022.
The Mid-Atlantic region contains 14.5% of establishments in 2022.
The Southeast region contains 14.3% of establishments in 2022.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The major environmental laws and regulations concerning the environment include the Clean Air Act, the Clean Water Act, the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act, the Occupational Safety and Health Act, the National Environmental Policy Act, and the Toxic Substances Control Act.
The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has stipulated rules concerning energy consumption and the water use of certain appliances (Appliance Labeling Rule).

There are at least three types of standards that internationally regulate the industry to reduce conformity assessment costs, decrease regulatory burden, reduce manufacturing, and distribution costs and get innovations to the market quicker.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry requires significant investment in research and development to produce quality products.
The industry has high fixed capital costs.
The industry has a high level of technology change, which can hinder entry of new operators. Gaining access to latest technology is costly but essential.
The industry is heavily regulated through requirements from organizations like the International Standardization Organization, which can deter new entrants.
Operators must comply with extremely small acceptable margin of error within end products to successfully enter and remain relevant.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition is primarily based on product quality, referring to measurement accuracy and capacity. Companies strive to provide products that can measure wider ranges of frequencies accurately, with higher number of decimal places in readings.
Companies compete in new product development to be first in the market and benefit from patents and intellectual property protection.
Companies offer value-added services like design solutions, application engineering, software development, repairs, and post-sales services to gain competitive edge.
Price is a key differentiator, with companies offering wide range of products at varying prices and trying to remain competitive on pricing for similar products. Rental options are also provided.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 4 companies account for 31.8% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top four largest companies account for an estimated 31.8% of industry revenue in 2022.
Market share concentration is especially high for operators manufacturing complex, high value equipment.
The number of industry enterprises has steadily declined over the five years to 2022, signaling concentration.
The industry experiences relatively high merger and acquisition activity due to competition for new technologies and products.
Collaboration is common among a shrinking number of operators, furthering market share concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: During the period consolidation and technological advancement have helped to offset the large decline brought about by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and the looming problem of import penetration which cuts into industry revenue.

Labor is used to operate various pieces of machinery and equipment and to manufacture industry products. However, operators are shifting away from a dependence on labor and are increasingly relying on technology and machinery to automate processes and improve efficiency.

The industry greatest expense is purchase costs. Purchases for this industry include metal products, circuit boards, semiconductors, plastic products, computing equipment and several others. Therefore, purchases are very susceptible to price changes and inflation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Electricity and Signal Testing Instrument Manufacturing industry has a low level of capital intensity. Industry operators generally invest $0.07 for every $1.00 spent on labor in 2022.
Although capital investment is required to manufacture high-grade products, highly skilled employees are required at several steps of the production process to provide a range of jobs.

The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Electricity and Signal Testing Instrument Manufacturing industry exhibits a moderate level of revenue volatility, with revenue falling as much as 6.6% in 2020, due to COVID-19 disruptions.
The industry does, however, rely heavily on international trade, as exports are expected to generate 50.6% of revenue in 2022.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Industry companies generally spend a great amount on research and development (R&D) in the industry because technology changes may require them to innovate products.
The rate of change varies between the different product segments; refer to the Products and Services section for more information.
Automated testing has a profound effect on industry products. Customers want Automated Test Equipment (ATE) to save time and efficiently record results.

FAQs.question: Is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports are a consistent threat for the industry operators, making foreign produces more competitive with domestic companies. Due to the low-wage costs, several foreign economies are able to produce less technologically advanced products more efficiently. Causing domestic operators to have to differentiate product offering to stay competitive. Due to the COVID-19 effects on both foreign and domestic markets, imports declined in 2020. However, as things cleared up in 2021 they would exhibit significant growth, as the dollar appreciated.

FAQs.question: Does your company produce a wide array of products or are they more specialized?
FAQs.answer: A majority of major players in this industry specialize in Electricity and Signal Testing Instruments, however the products are diverse enough to meet the needs of different downstream markets. Due to this diversification, many industry operators are able to weather the demand shocks that are brought about by something like the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: Has your company experienced volatile input prices during the current period?
FAQs.answer: During the period several input prices have experienced volatility. Most directly, steel and semiconductors have experienced volatility. In 2021 the price of steel increased a significant amount after falling in 2020. Semiconductors prices saw decreases through the period and is expected to grow in 2022.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into outsourcing labor to lower-wage economies?
FAQs.answer: While this would greatly reduce wage-costs for industry operators, it may not be as advantageous as it presents. Outsourcing may work for products that are not technologically intensive, however this industry relies on many high wage, high skill workers to produce most products.

FAQs.question: How is your company staying competitive for downstream markets?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators generally invest a large amount of money into research and development (R&D) efforts. In doing this operators are able to stay current and competitive to come out ahead of their competitors. Increased R&D also aids operators in diversification in order to shield against import penetration. Typically, a large percentage of wage costs goes towards recruiting and hiring highly skilled employees to conduct R&D.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility affected your profit within the last 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Profit has been constrained due to volatility in inputs and global trade situation. Because of this, price adjustment and forecasting is difficult, again hurting profit. Uncertainty around the US economic and global outlooks will continue to hinder profit moving forward.

FAQs.question: Is your company able to increase its global presence in foreign markets? Which export markets do you currently do business with?
FAQs.answer: Many of the large industry operators are able to scale production and operations up to meet the needs of global clients and changing markets. The COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted operators ability to fully emerge product lines in the global markets, however as economic prospects abroad recover the presence of domestics products abroad are likely to increase.

FAQs.question: How are you able to achieve economies of scale? Have you experienced any difficulties in the past regarding economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: It is important for operators in the industry to be able to achieve a lower per unit cost.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure they are making use of the latest technologies? What technologies are you currently able to access?
FAQs.answer: Due to the nature of the industry, operators need highly skilled employees to be able to compete and ensure they are efficiently using the newest technologies in the respective field. Highly skilled workers with a variety of skills help to ensure that the best practices and usage of new technologies are at play.

FAQs.question: How is demand for your company affected by fluctuation in aggregate private investment? Have you experienced substantial demand disruption from the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Several of the industry's downstream buyers are private entities. Therefore, an increase in aggregate private investment will generally lead to increased product innovation. Which translates to revenue gains. Aggregate private investment declined in 2020 due to the fallout of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, but had a strong rebound in 2021, and is expected to continue growth into 2022.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuations in the trade-weighted index affect international demand for your products? Has your company experienced export disruption following the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: When the US dollar appreciates, imports become less costly and import volumes increase, creating a more price-competitive atmosphere; a strong dollar also depresses industry exports because US products become more expensive on the world market.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor federal funding for defense? Do you have any government contracts?
FAQs.answer: Increasing federal funding for defense generally leads to revenue growth for the industry. Since a large downstream market for this industry is the US defense and aerospace industry. During 2019 and 2020, federal funding for US defense greatly increased, in turn, slowing any further decreases in industry revenue. However as the economy recovered in 2021, the government would ease spending on defense, as private sector growth returned.
